Nestled in the heart of Meghalaya, it is well known for its pleasant weather, pine-covered hills, and breathtaking landscapes. Among its many natural treasures, waterfalls are a major attraction for tourists. These waterfalls in Shillong offer a perfect escape into nature and let you take a peaceful break from the city's hustle and bustle. Whether you are a photographer, a trekker, or a nature lover, waterfalls in Shillong promise memorable experiences. From tall to calm cascades, the waterfalls are beautiful. Let‚Äôs explore the 15 best Waterfalls in Shillong and their nearby point of attraction that you must include in your¬†Meghalaya tour package.15 Best Waterfalls in ShillongThese 15 waterfalls in Shillong present the wonders of this remarkable travel destination, interesting and very calming. Keep reading to know all the best waterfalls to explore on your next trip:1. Elephant FallsElephant Falls is one of the most popular and easily accessible waterfalls in Shillong. In this waterfall, the water flows in three tiers which is why it is also known as the three-tier waterfall. Surrounded by lush greenery, each tier provides a different scenic beauty, making it a treat for photographers and nature lovers. The name of this falls comes from a rock that looked like an elephant near the falls, though it was destroyed in an earthquake. The clean and clear passages make it easily accessible for travellers. This waterfall is especially stunning during the monsoon season when the flow is stronger and more picturesque.Location: Near Upper Shillong, 12 km from city centerBest Time to Visit: July to SeptemberEntry Fee: ‚Çπ20 per personTimings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM2. Bishop & Beadon FallsBishop & Beadon Falls, a twin waterfalls located close to each other on the outskirts of Shillong. These falls drop into a deep gorge covered with dense forest. The view from the observation point is mesmerising, especially after a rainfall.¬†Bishop waterfall flows down in stages, which gives it a layered look, while Beadon waterfall has a smoother fall that flows down into the valley very quietly.¬†Though these waterfalls in Shillong are not as popular as Elephant Falls, they offer a peaceful and top-notch scenic experience, perfect for relaxation and for photography lovers. Trekking through the greenery to get better views of the falls adds to the adventure.Location: Suna Valley, 5 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: June to OctoberEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM3. Sweet FallsSweet Falls is considered one of the tallest and most dangerous waterfalls in Shillong. With a height of around 315 feet, it plunges straight down into a deep gorge. The waterfall is surrounded by dense forest and offers a stunning but wild view. Due to the strong water current and slippery rocks, swimming or going too close is strictly not recommended. However, the waterfall‚Äôs beauty and untouched surroundings make it a must-visit for those looking for nature in its purest form. It‚Äôs a peaceful location, ideal for nature walks and birdwatching.Location: Near Happy Valley, 8 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: July to OctoberEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM4. Crinoline FallsCrinoline Falls is located very close to the city centre, making it a convenient option for a short nature retreat. It‚Äôs a charming waterfall surrounded by trees and small gardens. The water drops into a pool, which was once used for swimming. The place is well-maintained and has basic facilities nearby, making it a good spot for families. Although not very famous, the falls offer a quiet environment perfect for picnics or relaxing walks. If you're staying in Shillong and looking for a nearby place to unwind, Crinoline Falls is a great option.Location: Near Lady Hydari Park, ShillongBest Time to Visit: Monsoon seasonEntry Fee: ‚Çπ10 per personTimings: 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM5. Spread Eagle FallsSpread Eagle Falls, also known as Sati Falls, is named because the waterfall is said to resemble an eagle with outstretched wings. Located on the outskirts of Shillong, this waterfall offers a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. It flows through rocks and creates a wide, open view as the water spreads out. This makes it very scenic and unique. It is not very crowded, so it is ideal for visitors looking to enjoy nature in solitude. The surroundings are filled with trees and rocky cliffs, adding to the beauty of the place.Location: 6 km from Shillong Cantonment AreaBest Time to Visit: June to SeptemberEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM6. Langshiang FallsLangshiang Falls is located about 120 km from Shillong and is considered one of the highest waterfalls in India. Hidden within West Khasi Hills, reaching this waterfall involves a bit of travel and trekking. But once there, the view is breathtaking. The waterfall plunges from a cliff surrounded by thick forests and hilly terrain. It is a perfect place for trekking lovers and adventurers. Because it's less commercialised, it provides a true offbeat experience in the heart of Meghalaya‚Äôs wilderness.Location: Near Nongstoin, West Khasi HillsBest Time to Visit: Post-monsoon seasonEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM7. Nohkalikai FallsNohkalikai Falls is perhaps the most iconic waterfall in Meghalaya. Located near Cherrapunji, around 70 km from Shillong, it is the tallest plunge waterfall in India with a height of 1,100 feet. The Nohkalikai waterfall is also famous for its emerald green pool at the bottom and the misty cliffs from which it drops. It is named after a tragic legend of a woman named Likai, whose story adds emotional depth to the visit. The viewing platform gives a wide-angle view of the falls and the lush valley below. It is a must-visit¬†tourist attraction in Meghalaya.Location: Near CherrapunjiBest Time to Visit: September to NovemberEntry Fee: ‚Çπ30 per personTimings: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM8. Kshaid Dainthlen FallsLocated between Shillong and Cherrapunji, Kshaid¬†Dainthlen Falls is a scenic waterfall associated with a local legend. It is said to be the place where the locals killed a giant snake named Dainthlen, and you can still see rock carvings nearby that tell the story. Apart from the mythological importance, the falls are surrounded by wide rocky plateaus and green valleys. It is less crowded and offers ample space for walking, photography, and enjoying the natural surroundings.Location: 58 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: Monsoon and post-monsoon monthsEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM9. Wah Kaba FallsWah Kaba Falls is a beautiful two-tiered waterfall located on the way to Cherrapunji from Shillong. It is a lesser-known waterfall but offers a magnificent view of water cascading down rocky hills into the deep valley below. There‚Äôs a viewpoint from where you can see the falls and the surrounding greenery. During the rainy season, the volume of water increases, making the view even more impressive. The path to the viewpoint involves a short hike, which adds to the overall experience.Location: 33 km from Shillong, near Cherrapunji highwayBest Time to Visit: June to SeptemberEntry Fee: ‚Çπ20 per personTimings: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM10. Nohsngithiang Falls (Seven Sisters Falls)Also known as the Seven Sisters Falls, this majestic waterfall is located near Cherrapunji, not far from Shillong. It is named so because the water breaks into seven streams as it tumbles down the high limestone cliffs. During the monsoon season, all seven streams of¬†Nohsngithiang Falls are clearly visible, creating a magnificent and wide cascade. The view from the nearby viewpoint is awe-inspiring, especially at sunset when the golden light enhances the beauty of the falls. It is one of the tallest waterfalls in India and a must-visit for all nature lovers.Location: Near Mawsmai Village, 60 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: July to OctoberEntry Fee: ‚Çπ30 per personTimings: 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM11. Thlumuwi FallsThlumuwi Falls is a scenic, less-known waterfall situated in the Jaintia Hills near Shillong. The waterfall flows through large boulders and forms a clear natural pool at the base, ideal for a refreshing dip. What makes this site even more special is the presence of historical stone bridges nearby, built centuries ago. Surrounded by greenery and calm vibes, it‚Äôs perfect for nature walks, picnics, and photography. This place offers a peaceful break from the usual tourist spots and is suitable for a short day trip.Location: Near Jowai, approx. 90 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: September to DecemberEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM12. Mawphlang FallsLocated near the sacred forest of Mawphlang, this waterfall is ideal for those looking to mix spirituality with nature. The waterfall is not very large, but its calm, steady flow and green surroundings make it a soothing sight. The nearby sacred forest is protected by local tribes and is rich in rare plants and biodiversity. Visiting this waterfall also gives you a chance to learn about Khasi culture and beliefs. It‚Äôs a great spot for relaxing and enjoying nature in its purest form.Location: 26 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: August to NovemberEntry Fee: Forest entry ‚Çπ20; waterfall area is freeTimings: 9:00 AM to 4:30 PM13. Lyngksiar FallsLyngksiar Falls is a hidden gem located in Sohra (Cherrapunji region). It is not very well-known, which makes it perfect for travelers who enjoy exploring untouched nature. The falls are surrounded by cliffs and caves and require a short trek through forest trails. During the rainy season, the waterfall becomes more powerful and fills up the rocky basin below. There are natural pools around the falls, often used by locals for bathing. This peaceful spot is ideal for adventure seekers and offbeat explorers.Location: Near Sohra, 65 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: July to SeptemberEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM14. Rainbow FallsAs the name suggests, Rainbow Falls is famous for the rainbow that forms in the mist of the waterfall during sunny weather. It‚Äôs located deep in the forest near Nongriat village and requires a trek through the famous double-decker living root bridge. Though the journey is long and challenging, the waterfall at the end is worth it. Crystal-clear water, jungle views, and the natural rainbow effect create an unforgettable scene. It‚Äôs a paradise for trekkers and photographers.Location: Near Nongriat Village, approx. 80 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: October to AprilEntry Fee: Free; trekking guide recommendedTimings: 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM15. Tyrshi FallsTyrshi Falls is located in Jowai and is often compared to a smaller version of the Elephant Falls. The water descends in multiple steps, giving it a beautiful, wide appearance. Visitors can walk along a narrow trail and a bamboo bridge to reach the falls. The surrounding paddy fields and open sky make it an ideal place for a picnic or peaceful walk. It‚Äôs less crowded and provides perfect photo opportunities for travelers looking for something different from the usual tourist sites.Location: Near Jowai, 85 km from ShillongBest Time to Visit: June to SeptemberEntry Fee: FreeTimings: 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM ¬†Shillong is one of the tourist destinations that can be rated as the best choice for anyone who enjoys nature and scenic landscapes. Starting from the well-known¬†waterfalls in Shillong, like Elephant Falls, to Nohkalikai Falls in and around Shillong, these falls welcome relief from the concrete jungle. If you want to take up an adventurous trek or just relax and listen to the sound of water falling on rocks, Shillong has a waterfall for it.¬†Frequently Asked Questions1.
